CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 16, 1941, pg. 21, reads: "A Real August 'Cooler' - For the past 24 years, Louis 'Blue' Geary has been one of Pittsburgh's favorite mixologists. Now at Gus Greenlee's popular Crawford Grill, 'Blue' suggests a mint julep (made the Cobbs Creek way) for a smooth drink these hot August days.  Here's how he makes it: Muddle four sprigs of mint and 1/2 spoon of sugar in mixing glass; 3 spoons water, 2 jiggers Cobbs Creek, mix well, strain into glass 2/3 filled with ice - add fruit and decorate with mint. - (Adv.)"
TitMainTitle: Portrait of bartender Louis "Blue" Geary holding mint julep beside bottle of Cobbs Creek, at bar in Crawford Grill No. 1.
